citation.article-title: Emended description of the genus Agromyces and description of Agromyces cerinus subsp. cerinus sp. nov., subsp. nov., Agromyces cerinus subsp. nitratus sp. nov., subsp. nov., Agromyces fucosus subsp. fucosus sp. nov., subsp. nov., and Agromyces fucosus subsp. hippuratus sp. nov., subsp. nov.

p.s: Description of Agromyces cerinus subsp. cerinus subsp. nov.
Agromyces cerinus subsp. cerinus (ce.ri'nus. M.L. adj. cerinus, honey yellow)
Strains of A. cerinus subsp. cerinus are distinguished by a specific cell wall sugar composition; tyvelose, xylose, and rhamnose are present.
Most strains grow on medium containing meso-inositol.
Acids are produced from lactose, salicin, or trehalose.
Acids are not produced from L-arabinose, inulin, or D-mannitol.
trans-Aconitate and formate are not utilized.
Organic nitrogen is not required for good growth.
The G+C content of the DNA is 72 mol% (as determined by the Tm method).
The type strain ofA. cerinus subsp. cerinus is strain VKM Ac-1340.
The description given above was based on six strains.
